page.title: 06LAW AND ORDER
page.content: The police station in Garstang has always been in Bowgrave,originally it was a house.The station is one of the oldest in Lancashire. It is situated in Bowgrave because the road running past was the main stage coach route between London and Edinburgh.Since it became a police station few changes have taken place,a Lion Intoximeter 3000 has been installed and the remainder of the house has been made into offices. At Garstang there are no mounted police because they are placed at Hutton,some do occasionally visit Garstang at the Whit Festival and other important events.The Lion Intoximeter mentioned earlier measures the amount of alcohol in a drivers breath.A policeman's job involves the protection of life and property,the maintenance of law and order and the prosecution of offenders By M.Houghton,C.Lister
